snippet: Egypt erupted into chaos on Friday, raising doubts about the authorities’ capacity to maintain order, as opponents of the military takeover fought security forces and civilians in the street.
abstract: Egypt erupts into violent chaos, raising doubts about the authorities' capacity to maintain order, as opponents of the military takeover fight security forces and their civilian allies in street battles across the capital and other cities; some reports put the civilian death toll at more than 100.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Egypt erupted into chaos on Friday, raising doubts about the authorities’ capacity to maintain order, as opponents of the military takeover fought security forces and civilians in the street.

headline.main: Blood and Chaos Prevail in Egypt, Testing Control
headline.print_headline: Blood and Chaos Prevail in Egypt, Testing Control
